name: Query Elset
description: An element set is a collection of Keplerian orbital elements describing an orbit of a particular satellite. The data is used along with an orbit propagator in order to predict the motion of a satellite. The element set, or elset for short, consists of identification data, the classical elements and drag parameters.

parameters.name: idElset
parameters.description: UUID of the elset.

parameters.name: idOnOrbit
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the satellite on-orbit object, if correlated. For the public catalog, the idOnOrbit is typically the satellite number as a string, but may be a UUID for analyst or other unknown or untracked satellites.

parameters.name: origNetwork
parameters.description: The originating source network on which this record was created, auto-populated by the system.

parameters.name: satNo
parameters.description: Satellite/Catalog number of the target on-orbit object. For history queries inequality operators are not allowed and limitations apply to the allowed range for the 'Between' operator.

parameters.name: classificationMarking
parameters.description: Classification marking of the data in IC/CAPCO Portion-marked format.

parameters.name: epoch
parameters.description: Elset epoch time in ISO 8601 UTC format, with microsecond precision.

parameters.name: uct
parameters.description: Boolean indicating this elset was unable to be correlated to a known object. This flag should only be set to true by data providers after an attempt to correlate to an on-orbit object was made and failed. If unable to correlate, the 'origObjectId' field may be populated with an internal data provider specific identifier.

parameters.name: meanMotion
parameters.description: Mean motion is the angular speed required for a body to complete one orbit, assuming constant speed in a circular orbit which completes in the same time as the variable speed, elliptical orbit of the actual body. Measured in revolutions per day.

parameters.name: eccentricity
parameters.description: The orbital eccentricity of an astronomical object is a parameter that determines the amount by which its orbit around another body deviates from a perfect circle. A value of 0 is a circular orbit, values between 0 and 1 form an elliptic orbit, 1 is a parabolic escape orbit, and greater than 1 is a hyperbolic escape orbit.

parameters.name: inclination
parameters.description: The angle between the equator and the orbit when looking from the center of the Earth. If the orbit went exactly around the equator from left to right, then the inclination would be 0. The inclination ranges from 0 to 180 degrees.

parameters.name: raan
parameters.description: Right ascension of the ascending node, or RAAN is the angle as measured in degrees eastwards (or, as seen from the north, counterclockwise) from the First Point of Aries to the ascending node, which is where the orbit crosses the equator when traveling north.

parameters.name: argOfPerigee
parameters.description: The argument of perigee is the angle in degrees formed between the perigee and the ascending node. If the perigee would occur at the ascending node, the argument of perigee would be 0.

parameters.name: meanAnomaly
parameters.description: Where the satellite is in its orbital path. The mean anomaly ranges from 0 to 360 degrees. The mean anomaly is referenced to the perigee. If the satellite were at the perigee, the mean anomaly would be 0.

parameters.name: revNo
parameters.description: The current revolution number. The value is incremented when a satellite crosses the equator on an ascending pass.

parameters.name: bStar
parameters.description: The drag term for SGP4 orbital model, used for calculating decay constants for altitude, eccentricity etc, measured in inverse earth radii.

parameters.name: agom
parameters.description: AGOM, expressed in m^2/kg, is the value of the (averaged) object Area times the solar radiation pressure coefficient(Gamma) over the object Mass. Applicable only with ephemType4.

parameters.name: ballisticCoeff
parameters.description: Ballistic coefficient, in m^2/kg. Applicable only with ephemType4.

parameters.name: meanMotionDot
parameters.description: 1st derivative of the mean motion with respect to time. Units are revolutions per day squared.

parameters.name: meanMotionDDot
parameters.description: 2nd derivative of the mean motion with respect to time. Units are revolutions per day cubed.

parameters.name: semiMajorAxis
parameters.description: The sum of the periapsis and apoapsis distances divided by two. For circular orbits, the semimajor axis is the distance between the centers of the bodies, not the distance of the bodies from the center of mass. Units are kilometers.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Period of the orbit equal to inverse of mean motion, in minutes.

parameters.name: apogee
parameters.description: The orbit point furthest from the center of the earth in kilometers. If not provided, apogee will be computed from the TLE according to the following. Using mu, the standard gravitational parameter for the earth (398600.4418), semi-major axis A = (mu/(n*2*pi/(24*3600))^2)(1/3). Using semi-major axis A, eccentricity E, apogee = (A * (1 + E)) in km. Note that the calculations are for computing the apogee radius from the center of the earth, to compute apogee altitude the radius of the earth should be subtracted (6378.135 km).

parameters.name: perigee
parameters.description: The orbit point nearest to the center of the earth in kilometers. If not provided, perigee will be computed from the TLE according to the following. Using mu, the standard gravitational parameter for the earth (398600.4418), semi-major axis A = (mu/(n*2*pi/(24*3600))^2)(1/3). Using semi-major axis A, eccentricity E, perigee = (A * (1 - E)) in km. Note that the calculations are for computing the perigee radius from the center of the earth, to compute perigee altitude the radius of the earth should be subtracted (6378.135 km).

parameters.name: origObjectId
parameters.description: Optional identifier provided by elset source to indicate the target onorbit object of this elset. This may be an internal identifier and not necessarily map to a valid satellite number.

parameters.name: idOrbitDetermination
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the OD solution record that produced this elset.

parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.description: Optional algorithm used to produce this record.

parameters.name: transactionId
parameters.description: Optional identifier to track a commercial or Marketplace transaction executed to produce this data.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional array of provider/source specific tags for this data, where each element is no longer than 32 characters, used for implementing data owner conditional access controls to restrict access to the data. Should be left null by data providers unless conditional access controls are coordinated with the UDL team.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Time the row was created in the database, auto-populated by the system.

parameters.name: createdBy
parameters.description: Application user who created the row in the database, auto-populated by the system.

parameters.name: sourceDL
parameters.description: The source data library from which this record was received. This could be a remote or tactical UDL or another data library. If null, the record should be assumed to have originated from the primary Enterprise UDL.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Source of the data.

parameters.name: origin
parameters.description: Originating system or organization which produced the data, if different from the source. The origin may be different than the source if the source was a mediating system which forwarded the data on behalf of the origin system. If null, the source may be assumed to be the origin.

parameters.name: dataMode
parameters.description: Indicator of whether the data is REAL, TEST, SIMULATED, or EXERCISE data.

parameters.name: effectiveUntil
parameters.description: End time at which this elset was no longer the 'current' elset for its satellite.

parameters.name: effectiveFrom
parameters.description: Start time at which this elset was the 'current' elset for its satellite.

parameters.name: descriptor
parameters.description: Optional source-provided and searchable metadata or descriptor of the data.

parameters.name: ephemType
parameters.description: The ephemeris type associated with this TLE: 0: SGP (or SGP4 with Kozai mean motion); 1: SGP (Kozai mean motion); 2: SGP4 (Brouver mean motion); 3: SDP4; 4: SGP4-XP; 5: SDP8; 6: SP (osculating mean motion).
